name: Osric
appearance: Tall and spare with an iron-gray beard, tide-clock brooch, and a cane-sword he swears he never draws; his cloak smells of kelp and cold iron.
character: Austere and even-handed, carrying weariness like a duty; he believes rules save lives.
talents: recalls clauses and case names verbatim
reads tics of guilt and fear
predicts tides by scent and sound
flaws: lonely to the point of detachment
too trusting of Compact neutrality claims
dreams: Unmask the forged-pass ring at the Flats
Retire to the Salt Widow’s Lighthouse and write a treatise on oathcraft
secrets: Keeps a salt-stiff journal from the Lighthouse that he never entered into the record
Has an illegitimate son rumored to run with wreckers
Once staged ‘found’ evidence to prevent a riot he feared would kill dozens
